column4: OpenAI's flagship multimodal model that accepts text, audio, image, and video inputs, and can output text, audio, and images. Best choice for advanced tool use, vision, and multimodal workflows.
column9: Multimodal capabilities, Advanced tool use, Vision processing, Real-time audio processing, Function calling, Structured outputs

column4: Cost-efficient small multimodal model with strong performance on text and image tasks. Video and audio capabilities coming soon.
column9: Cost-efficient, Text and image processing, MMLU: 82.0%, MGSM: 87.0%, HumanEval: 87.2%, MMMU: 59.4%, Function calling, Structured outputs

column4: Advanced reasoning model with chain-of-thought capabilities, designed for complex problem-solving, strategy, coding, and analytical tasks.
column9: Chain-of-thought reasoning, Complex problem solving, Strategy ideation, Advanced coding capabilities, Mathematical reasoning, No image input support

column4: Limited-access early release of the o1 reasoning model, reserved for original preview access holders.
column9: Single reasoning mode, Limited access, Advanced reasoning capabilities, No developer messages support, No structured outputs

column4: Cost-efficient reasoning model that matches or exceeds o1-preview on STEM benchmarks while being significantly cheaper and faster.
column9: Three reasoning-effort settings (low, medium, high), Structured outputs support, Developer messages support, Streaming support, 80% lower cost than o1-preview, Faster processing, Strong STEM performance

column4: Latest reasoning model optimized for STEM reasoning (science, math, coding) with improved accuracy and performance over o1-mini.
column9: Three reasoning-effort options, Structured outputs support, Developer messages support, Streaming support, Function calling, STEM optimization, 39% fewer major errors vs o1-mini, 24% lower latency, Triple ChatGPT rate limits

column4: Advanced image generation model that creates entirely new images from text prompts with built-in safety moderation.
column9: Text-to-image generation, Built-in moderation filters, Multiple output formats (PNG, JPG), Multiple resolutions (256×256, 512×512, 1024×1024), Automatic prompt rewriting for safety and detail, No edit or variation endpoints

column4: Speech-to-text model supporting 50+ languages and dialects with improved accuracy for low-quality audio and accents.
column9: 50+ languages and dialects support, Improved low-quality audio handling, Overlapping speech recognition, Accent handling, Language identification, Timestamped word-level alignments

column4: Speed-optimized text-to-speech model designed for real-time applications with sub-200ms startup in streaming mode.
column9: Six preset voices (Alloy, Echo, Fable, Onyx, Nova, Shimmer), Multiple output formats (MP3, Opus, AAC, FLAC), Real-time streaming support, Sub-200ms startup latency, Optimized for speed

column4: Quality-optimized text-to-speech model designed for naturalness with higher audio quality than the speed-optimized variant.
column9: Six preset voices (Alloy, Echo, Fable, Onyx, Nova, Shimmer), Multiple output formats (MP3, Opus, AAC, FLAC), Real-time streaming support, ~500ms startup latency, Optimized for quality and naturalness

column4: Cost-efficient embedding model that maps text into numerical vectors for semantic search, clustering, and RAG applications.
column9: 1,536 dimensions, 5× cheaper than ada-002, Improved multilingual performance, MIRACL avg: 44.0%, MTEB avg: 62.3%, Best balance of cost and performance

column4: High-performance embedding model with configurable dimensions for demanding multilingual retrieval and semantic tasks.
column9: 3,072 dimensions (configurable), Highest accuracy for multilingual retrieval, Configurable dimensionality, MIRACL avg: 54.9%, MTEB avg: 64.6%, Superior semantic fidelity

column4: Most capable moderation model built on GPT-4o, supporting both text and image inputs with multimodal classification across harm categories.
column9: Multimodal classification (text + images), 42% better multilingual accuracy across 40 languages, Six multimodal categories, Two new text-only categories (illicit, illicit/violent), Calibrated probability scores, Free for all developers
